title: onclass
description:
OnClass is a python package for single-cell cell type annotation. It uses the Cell Ontology to capture the cell type similarity. 
These similarities enable OnClass to annotate cell types that are never seen in the training data.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input (query) data to be labeled
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input (query) data to be labeled. Should be a .h5mu file.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process.

input_layer.description: Type: `string`. The layer in the input data to be used for cell type annotation if
input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. The layer in the input data to be used for cell type annotation if .X is not to be used.

input_var_gene_names.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column in the input data containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used
input_var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column in the input data containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used.

input_reference_gene_overlap.description: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. The minimum number of genes present in both the reference and query datasets
input_reference_gene_overlap.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. The minimum number of genes present in both the reference and query datasets.

output.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file.

output_obs_predictions.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `onclass_pred`. In which `.obs` slots to store the predicted information.

output_obs_probability.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `onclass_prob`. In which `.obs` slots to store the probability of the predictions.

cl_nlp_emb_file.help_text: Type: `file`, required. The .nlp.emb file with the cell type embeddings.

cl_ontology_file.help_text: Type: `file`, required. The .ontology file with the cell type ontology.

cl_obo_file.help_text: Type: `file`, required. The .obo file with the cell type ontology.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: Arguments related to the reference dataset.
Type: `file`, example: `reference.h5mu`. The reference data to train the CellTypist classifiers on
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `reference.h5mu`. The reference data to train the CellTypist classifiers on. Only required if a pre-trained --model is not provided.

reference_layer.description: Type: `string`. The layer in the reference data to be used for cell type annotation if
reference_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. The layer in the reference data to be used for cell type annotation if .X is not to be used.

reference_obs_target.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `cell_ontology_class`. The name of the adata obs column in the reference data containing cell type annotations
reference_obs_target.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `cell_ontology_class`. The name of the adata obs column in the reference data containing cell type annotations.

reference_var_gene_names.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column in the reference data containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used
reference_var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column in the reference data containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used.

reference_var_input.help_text: Type: `string`. .var column containing highly variable genes. By default, do not subset genes.

unknown_celltype.description: Type: `string`, default: `Unknown`. Label for unknown cell types
unknown_celltype.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `Unknown`. Label for unknown cell types.

model.description: Type: `string`. "Pretrained model path without a file extension
model.help_text:
Type: `string`. "Pretrained model path without a file extension. If not provided, the model will be trained 
on the reference data and --reference should be provided. The path namespace should contain:
  - a .npz or .pkl file
  - a .data file
  - a .meta file
  - a .index file
e.g. /path/to/model/pretrained_model_target1 as saved by OnClass."

max_iter.description: Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Maximum number of iterations for training the model
max_iter.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Maximum number of iterations for training the model.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
